thinking.disposable_income: Albany Park has a median household income of around $53,000, lower than Chicago's average. About 16% of residents live below poverty level, indicating many residents have limited disposable income
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Given the moderate-to-low income levels, residents are price-sensitive to both transit fares and sales taxes. Many households need to carefully budget discretionary spending
thinking.accessibility: Well-served by CTA Brown Line, multiple bus routes, and major arterial roads. About 36% of residents use public transit for commuting, 45% drive, indicating balanced modal split. Many residents depend on both transit and driving
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritize lower transit fares and moderate sales tax to help lower-income residents while maintaining service quality. 2. Support some driving fees to improve transit service without excessive burden. 3. Balance between travel time improvements and cost impacts. 4. Consider high transit usage in the community. 5. Avoid highest tax/fee combinations that would strain household budgets. Selected policies that offer good transit service improvements while keeping costs manageable for mixed-income population
